intro: Secamone gabonensis, commonly known as Gabon secamone, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals, often in shades of white or pale yellow. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
